intro: Actinodaphne sesquipedalis subsp. sesquipedalis, commonly known as the long-leaf actinodaphne, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows in lowland tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and often have a distinctive aromatic scent. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark purple berries, which are an important food source for various wildlife species.
